newsitem.title: USA: Yahoo! says launches VISA -sponsored area.
newsitem.headline: Yahoo! says launches VISA -sponsored area.

text.p: Internet directory firm Yahoo! Inc on Tuesday said it unveiled an area at its Internet site sponsored solely by VISA U.S.A., in a program designed to boost Visa's brand awareness on the Internet.
VISA's "microsite" within Yahoo!, named "SiteSeer," will provide original weekly content, consisting mostly of links to interesting locations on the World Wide Web.

Yahoo! is located at http://www.yahoo.com. To date, most advertisements at the site rotate, like commercials aired during a television program. Visa's dedicated site is the first such for Yahoo!'s site, which was visited by more than 14 million viewers a day in September, Yahoo! said.

The SiteSeer programming on Yahoo! will also steer visitors to VISA's Web site, VISA Expo at http://www.visa.com, they said. There, users will find information on services and promotions offered by VISA.
The SiteSeer site was developed by Softbank Corp's Softbank Interactive Marketing and the New York-based advertising agency, BBDO Worldwide.
Visa is a financial services company owned by a consotium of banks.
